title: 112_hr1822
content: The Act titled "No Health Care Subsidies for Illegal Aliens Act of 2011" establishes procedures for eligibility determinations under Title I of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. The Act "No Health Care Subsidies for Illegal Aliens Act of 2011" amends the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to require in-person attestation of citizenship or lawful permanent resident status for eligibility determinations. The Act "No Health Care Subsidies for Illegal Aliens Act of 2011" requires a sworn statement, under penalty of perjury, attesting to citizenship or eligibility for coverage under a qualified health plan offered through an Exchange. The Act requires satisfactory evidence of citizenship or nationality for enrollees based on attestation, as well as evidence of satisfactory immigration status for enrollees based on attestation. The Act requires enrollees to demonstrate satisfactory immigration status through the Systematic Alien Verification for Entitlements program and additional identifying information as required by the Secretary in consultation with the Secretary of Homeland Security. Each Exchange must verify citizenship or immigration status through documentary evidence as part of eligibility verification. The Exchange verifies citizenship or immigration status through documentary evidence for enrollment eligibility. The curr_chunk amends documentation requirements and eliminates secretarial authority to modify verification methods under Section 1411 of the Act. It also includes conforming amendments related to secretarial verification requirements. The curr_chunk amends Section 1411 of the Act by redesignating subsections and making conforming amendments related to secretarial verification requirements. The curr_chunk amends Section 1411(d)(3) by updating the verification process to align with the Social Security Act as of January 1, 2011. The amendments made by this Act will be effective as if they were part of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act enactment.
